intro: Lippia salviifolia, commonly known as Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Lippia salviifolia is also valued in horticulture for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
